title.narrative: Modernization and restructuring of the road sector

description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to strengthen the institutional effectiveness, enhance the operational efficiency and increase the debt service capacity of Croatia's road sector.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Acceptable governance plans for each road sector company | Description :The Borrower shall cause Each RoadSector Company to approve a governance plan acceptable to the Bank by June 30, 2017 and to ensure its implementation. | Due Date:30-Jun-2017

Finance Agreement :Acceptable investment programs for road construction and maintenance | Description :The Public Road Constructionand Maintenance Program of the Republic of Croatia as defined in the Roads Act and the annual construction and maintenance plansdefined by the RSC are defined and include investment programs acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Audit of reimbursement applications | Description :For purposes of Part B(c) (ii) of the Project, the Bank shallrequire that the Borrower carries out a specific audit of the reimbursement applications related to the Retrenchment Paymentsfinanced under the Project as part of the regular project audit. Such audit shall include agreed upon procedures to obtainreasonable assurance on the eligibility, existence, correct amounts of paid Retrenchment obligations under the Project. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :retroactive financing | Description :No withdrawal shall be made for payments made prior to the date signatureof the Loan Agreement, except that withdrawals up to an aggregate amount not to exceed Euro three million (â‚¬ 3,000,000) may bemade for payments made prior to this date but on or after January 1, 2017, for Eligible Expenditures under Category (1). | Due Date:31-Dec-2017

title.narrative: Percent of HC network where county agencies (ZUC) participate in joint procurement committee
Percentage of TEN-T road network for which road safety audit or inspection as per EU Directive 2008/96 has been carried out [B.7]
Gender balancing - Ratio of women in the motorway sector after retrenchment
Citizen engagement - Maintain full responsiveness rate to comments and grievances from citizens
Weighted average maturity of road sector companies' debt
Status of implementation of new financing strategy for HAC, ARZ and HC as implemented under the coordination of the National Government [A.1]

target.value: Debt restructuring transactions contemplated in Financing Strategy are executed

actual.value: Financing strategy approved; execution of debt optimization transactions at three stages through 2019.

title.narrative: Status of implementation of new tolling revenue enhancement measures [B.4]

target.value: New automated tolling system completely implemented

actual.value: New tolling strategy endorsed by MSTI; advanced preliminary study accepted; bidding docs not yet prepared

title.narrative: Percent Reduction in Operating Cost of Motorways relative to baseline: HAC and ARZ [B.3]

actual.value: Current: 6.7 percent (768 mn HRK) HAC: 586 mn HRK ARZ: 182 mn HRK [results of end 2020]

title.narrative: Operating Expense Ratio (Total Operating Expenses / Total Operating Revenue)
Weighted Average toll revenue per Vehicle-Km travelled [B.4]
Operating Expenditures per kilometer of road network
Staff per Kilometer of road under operation (motorways) [B.3]
Reduction in Operating Cost for State Roads relative to baseline: HC [B.6]

actual.value: Current: HC: 656 mn HRK [results of end 2020]

title.narrative: Ability of MSTI to monitor and enforce performance of motorway and road companies using Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and standardized accounting measures
Operational status of Planning Department established within MSTI [A.2]

baseline.value: Inexistent planning and coordination functions within MSTI

title.narrative: Ability of MSTI to plan road sector investments

target.value: Motorway and road networks managed under rolling investment plans

actual.value: Planning department under MSTI renamed "Road Infrastructure Project Financing and Support Service" since January 2021; transportstrategy approved and in force

title.narrative: Status of implementation of improved and harmonized accounting standards [A.3]
Status of Implementation of Road Asset Management System (RAMS) development and incorporation in planning [B.2]

baseline.value: Road sector agencies and companies do not have integrated RAMS

target.value: RAMS inputs incorporated in rolling plan

actual.value: RAMS technical specification prepared and no-objected by Bank; bidding documents prepared but procurement not launched.

title.narrative: Status of implementation of end-performance road maintenance standards [B.1]

target.value: Service standards incorporated in rolling plan

actual.value: Maintenance standards consultancy completed. Standards for HAC are developed and published; for HC planned by end 2022

title.narrative: Private Direct Mobilization (Debt Refinancing & Rescheduling with support of IBRD Guarantee)

target.value: over 900 mn EUR of debt refinanced and over 2 bn EUR rescheduled for all companies

actual.value: 1.675 bn EUR refinanced and 1.8 bn EUR rescheduled through 2019 (three stages)
